definition[0]: a mountain with a large hole at the top, through which lava (=very hot liquid rock) is sometimes forced out
note[0]: extinct volcano (=one that is no longer active at all)
example[0]: Pompei was destroyed when the volcano erupted in 79 AD.
example[1]: The volcano last erupted 50 years ago.
example[2]: Mount Etna is still an active volcano.
example[3]: Volcanoes can remain dormant for hundreds of years.
example[4]: The lake is at the foot of an extinct volcano.
